titleStmt.title: Votes in Parliament for setling of the kingdome, by a King, Lords, and Commons, and the debate of the house, touching propositions to the King, treaties, &c. With the proceedings upon the city petition. Also, a relation of the last fight in Wales, colonell Flemming and many others of the Parliaments forces killed and taken prisoners.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: Votes in Parliament for setling of the kingdome, by a King, Lords, and Commons, and the debate of the house, touching propositions to the King, treaties, &c. With the proceedings upon the city petition. Also, a relation of the last fight in Wales, colonell Flemming and many others of the Parliaments forces killed and taken prisoners.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: The votes and orders are dated 27-29 April 1648.
The letter from Wales is dated at the end: Carmarthen 24. April 1648.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
